extendedIngredients.name: bacon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 oz bacon, cooked to a crisp and crumbled (Be sure to reserve some bacon drippings for the marinade above)

extendedIngredients.name: basil leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: Herbs - I used 6 basil leaves, 1 sprig of fresh rosemary and about 2 Tbsp of fresh thyme; all chopped.

extendedIngredients.name: eggs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 large eggs, hard boiled. Separate yolks from whites and chop whites.

extendedIngredients.name: sour cream
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup sour cream (in a pinch I've used Greek yogurt)
metaInformation: (in a pinch I've used Greek yogurt)

recipes.title: Sour Cream and Bacon Potato Salad
recipes.instructions: Combine the bacon fat, olive oil, vinegar, herbs and garlic salt in a small food processor or shaker jar and combine well.Season with pepper to taste.Clean (but do not peel) the potatoes and cut into 1" cubes. Immerse in salted water; bring water to a boil and boil for 7-10 minutes, testing potatoes to see if they are done. They should be firm but easily penetrated with a fork.Remove from heat, drain and place back into pot.Add the marinade and stir gently to cover all of the potatoes; refrigerate for at least one-half hour.Mash egg yolks finely with a fork in a medium size bowl. Make the dressing by combining the yolks with the mayonnaise, sour cream and Dijon mustard; mix with a whisk and season with salt and pepper.Add dressing, chopped egg whites, bacon and green onion to potatoes and mix gently. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper if necessary.Refrigerate for a minimum of one hour before serving; best if made ahead and refrigerated overnight.Garnish before serving with green onion and bacon bits.

steps.step: Combine the bacon fat, olive oil, vinegar, herbs and garlic salt in a small food processor or shaker jar and combine well.Season with pepper to taste.Clean (but do not peel) the potatoes and cut into 1" cubes. Immerse in salted water; bring water to a boil and boil for 7-10 minutes, testing potatoes to see if they are done. They should be firm but easily penetrated with a fork.
Remove from heat, drain and place back into pot.

Add the marinade and stir gently to cover all of the potatoes; refrigerate for at least one-half hour.Mash egg yolks finely with a fork in a medium size bowl. Make the dressing by combining the yolks with the mayonnaise, sour cream and Dijon mustard; mix with a whisk and season with salt and pepper.

Add dressing, chopped egg whites, bacon and green onion to potatoes and mix gently. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper if necessary.Refrigerate for a minimum of one hour before serving; best if made ahead and refrigerated overnight.
Garnish before serving with green onion and bacon bits.
